Name: Lady Liadrin
Aquisition:
Lady Liadrin in her introductory cinematicLady Liadrin can be obtained for free by raising a character to level 20 in World of Warcraft. Once unlocked the player can choose to use Lady Liadrin in place of Uther Lightbringer when playing with a paladin deck.
Raising any character to level 20 will result in the completion of the related achievement. This includes new characters and characters which were created prior to the promotion; creating a new character is not required. For example, raising a character that was previously at level 19 to level 20 will complete the achievement. However, Character Boosts will not count toward the achievement.[2] 
Unlocking Lady Liadrin is not region-sensitive - unlocking her in World of Warcraft in any region should unlock her in all Hearthstone regions for that account.[3]
Note that Lady Liadrin is not awarded retroactively; players who already have one or more characters at or above level 20 in World of Warcraft must still raise a further character to level 20 in order to obtain the hero.
This promotion is free, and does not require any purchase to complete. Characters can be raised to level 20 using the game's Starter Edition, without spending any money.
It is not possible to purchase Liadrin, either with gold or real money.[4]

Two copies of Frost Nova are a reward for raising a mage to level 6.
Two Golden copies of Frost Nova are a reward for raising a mage to levels 23 and 26.
Frost Nova is uncraftable and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.

Two copies of Ironbark Protector are a reward for raising a druid to level 10.
Two Golden copies of Ironbark Protector are a reward for raising a druid to levels 49 and 50.
Ironbark Protector is uncraftable and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.

Two copies of River Crocolisk are automatically included in all players' collections upon unlocking the druid class.

River Crocolisk is uncraftable and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.

Shadow Word: Death is uncraftable and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.

Name: Morgl the Oracle
Aquisition:
Morgl cannot be purchased, but can be obtained for free through the Recruit A Friend system. Once a recruited player accumulates a total level of 20, combined between every class, the recruiting player will be awarded Morgl. After unlocking, the player can choose to use Morgl the Oracle in place of Thrall when playing with a shaman deck.
As with other rewards from the Recruit A Friend system, note that only players recruited to play in the same region as the recruiter will count for earning Morgl.
It is not possible to purchase Morgl, either with gold or real money.

Once the regular version has been obtained, both regular and golden versions can be crafted and disenchanted.

Once the regular version has been obtained, both regular and golden versions can be crafted and disenchanted.
